intro: Licaria mexicana, commonly known as Mexican licaria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and are often covered in fine hairs. Licaria mexicana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
